content: In the following questions, I will provide you with a graph (given as an array of nodes and an array of edges), a starting point, and a target point. Please return the shortest path from the starting point to the target point in the following format: 1->2->3->4... Please note that your answer should only include the result in this format and should not contain any other words.(Notice that for the same graph, if the endpoint is changed to the previous point, the new shortest path should be the original shortest path minus the last point.)

The shortest path from node 3 to node 9 in the provided graph is:

1->2->4->6->9

Note that the path is shortest because it avoids the intermediate nodes 5 and 7. If you change the endpoint to the previous point (i.e., from node 9 to node 6), the new shortest path would be:

1->2->4->6

This is because the path from node 3 to node 6 is shorter than any other path between these two nodes.

The shortest path from node 3 to node 4 in the provided graph is:

3->2->4

Note that the path is shortest because it avoids the intermediate nodes 1, 5, 6, 7, 8, and 10. If you change the endpoint to the previous point (i.e., from node 4 to node 2), the new shortest path would be:

3->2

This is because the path from node 3 to node 2 is shorter than any other path between these two nodes.
